question: A corked bottle full of water when frozen will break due to which of the following reasons?
option2: the volume of water decreases on freezing
option3: the volume of water increases on freezing
option4: glass is a bad conductor of heat
answer: the volume of water increases on freezing
explanation: If you put a glass bottle in the freezer, the level of the liquid will decrease as the temperature drops, until 3.98 C, at which point it starts to expand again as the volume of water increases on freezing. So unless the glass jar is tremendously strong, as the water freezes, it will break.
